home.title: Chorder
home.subtitle: The ultimate music tool
options.title: Options
instrument.title: Instrument
name: Name
infoModal.what-chordmaker: Chordmaker is a free chord encyclopedia where you can search for chords.
infoModal.usage2-chordmaker: To search for a chord, select the tiles with your notes and Chordmaker will provide you the chord given from all the possible notes combination.
infoModal.usage4-chordmaker: If a chord is displayed, click on his name to see all of his traits
infoModal.usage6-chordmaker: Click on the buttons to listen to che chord, or to an arpeggio of the chord (you can always change the instrument in the options).
infoModal.what-notefinder: Notefinder is a free chord encyclopedia where you can find the notes of every chord.
infoModal.usage2-notefinder: To search for a chord, select the Tonic or first note of your chord, then you can either use the filters or the seachbar.
infoModal.usage4-notefinder: If a chord is displayed, click on his name to see his notes and all of his traits
infoModal.usage6-notefinder: Click on the buttons to listen to che chord, or to an arpeggio of the chord (you can always change the instrument in the options).
infoModal.what-metronome: Metronome is a free metronome and polyrhythm generator.
infoModal.usage-bpm-metronome: To set the BPM, use the buttons, the slider or tap the tempo.
infoModal.usage-increase-metronome: For a training session you can make the metronome gradually increase the BPM checking this button.
infoModal.usage-final-metronome: The final BPM the target at which the metronome will stop increasing.
infoModal.usage-step-metronome: The step is the number of BPM by which the metronome increases each time.
infoModal.usage-measures-metronome: Measures is the number of measures between each change.
infoModal.usage-beats-metronome: To set the beats you can use the buttons, then you can change the color of the sound of each metronome. In addition you can choose to highlight or not the first beat of each measure
infoModal.usage-add-metronome: To create polyrhythm add or remove a metronome with the bottom rigth or left button.
